title: Creation of E-museum as Open Educational Resource Repository of Organisms for Students of Biological Sciences

author: Sarita Kumar, Acharya Narendra Dev College, University of Delhi
Charu K. Gupta, Acharya Narendra Dev College, University of Delhi

segmentation: Good evening, we present before you a concept of creating a museum which is a repository online available wherein we are creating this repository of all biological organisms these days we all talk about global warming and it is causing a lot of damage to the biological organisms.
The biological species.
The biodiversity is being eroded at a tremendous rate, especially the effect is seen in the tropical countries.
Now, before even documenting all these pieces which are available, we are losing on many speeches, and this is primarily one of the reasons that we thought of documenting and putting these online.
Another reason for having this emuseum is to document.
And because the University grants come.
Which is a major Funding Agency in India, has banned the usage of life specimens.
My colleague Doctor Saritha will talk about it.

Yeah hello yeah, in India the use of animals in experimentation as well as the use of specimens as a museum museology has been banned totally initially before two years before they issued the guidelines to phase out the specimens.
But now they have completely banned the use of animals for the experimentation.
Becausw.
There are many reasons.
One is the losing biodiversity, another sensitization toward animals, because there are many.
Animal activists who are raising their voices for sensitization when the animals are kept in captivity and when they are used in experimentation that there is a cruelity behind this.
So it has been completely banned.
So we thought of creating.
That was the main trigger event actually because because of that we thought of creating app repository so that students academicians are.
At least aware of the biological.
You can say biodiversity available on the Earth, so we are we have taken this initiative as an individual.
This is an individual initiative.
We do not have any funding or any organization involved with us.
Two of us.
One of my other colleagues, three of us are doing work on this and now 2 three students are also.
They're doing undergraduate students who are doing voluntary work in this project.
A basic idea is to create the knowledge based repository an in which there will be.

Different organisms which are available existing on the Earth which are extinct which are threatened species and which are, maybe you can say other species, even animals, as well as plants, microbes, all organisms, the.
Repository of initially we started using wiki platform because we did not have any other platform to create the repository and it was under CC license.
But now we are linking this repository to our University website because we want to share this knowledge across the globe among the other universities and so that it can be the global level.
This is iaccessible.

Anybody, even we thought of that, suppose the student in rural India who can also access that repository and but there are many challenges and constraints we are facing because we do not have any financial support for with us as well as we do not have any headcounts who can work on this.
We do not have any web developers and we do not have any designers.
We do not have salaries to pay.
We do not have space.
We do not have any access but still we are working on it.
And we have developed a website.
This is a main page where we have created the.
We have started the creating the repository and few screenshots.
I would like to show you.
These are the speciments we are adding the pictures.
We are clicking the pictures, we are drawing the pictures with labels and we are classifying them.
We are using habitat habitat features, characteristic features.
We are adding videos.
We are running animation.
We are adding MCQS, quizzes and other questions so that students can.
Yes also and anybody who wants to collaborate with this most welcome.
And these are the other screenshots I would like to show you.
So tomorrow we would like to invite you to see our posters to give us additions anybody wants to collaborate with us most welcome.
Thank you so much.
